form.label: HOWTO CPU_ALL: Generate stats and charts with Splunk Search Processing Language (SPL)
form.description: This collection of request samples will help you generating your own reports, dashboards and alerts for Nmon Performance data using the native Search Processing Language

h2.a: CPU Percentage Usage Statistics (click here for more information)

div.h1: CPU_ALL monitor: Percentage load CPU statistics

div.i:
The Howto interface uses the SPL language to manipulate and generate statistics of CPU utilization.
Most of the fields are extracted and calculated automatically at search time, for convenience the application uses some generic fields that will be applicable for any supported operating system, as described above.

lu.li: cpu_load_percent: % of CPU usage for all available cores (Sys_PCT+User_PCT+Wait_PCT)
Idle_PCT: % of CPU time free, meaning not having task to do
Sys_PCT: % of CPU time spent in kernel mode
User_PCT: % of CPU time spent in user mode
Wait_PCT: % of CPU time spent in waiting for resources
cpu_load_user: Alias to User_PCT (% of CPU tim spent in user mode)

panel.title: Optionally preset frameID and/or hostname and press Enter:
Time oriented and statistics oriented charts:

div.h2: Average CPU Usage in Percentage over last 24 hours using the custom span macro, in a line chart by server names (auto span definition to best accurate value possible)
div.pre: eventtype=nmon:performance type=CPU_ALL frameID=$frameID$ hostname=$hostname$ | timechart `nmon_span` avg(cpu_load_percent) AS cpu_load_percent by hostname

div.h2: Average Sys / User / Wait /Idle CPU Usage in a 100% stack area chart of a specific server over last 24 hours with a static span of 5 minutes
div.pre: eventtype=nmon:performance type=CPU_ALL frameID=$frameID$ hostname=$hostname$ | timechart span=5m avg(Sys_PCT) AS Sys_PCT, avg(User_PCT) AS User_PCT, avg(Wait_PCT) AS Wait_PCT, avg(Idle_PCT) AS Idle_PCT

div.h2: Average CPU Usage in Percentage over last 30 days for Working hours Business days only (monday to friday, 08h to 19h) with auto span (custom macro span definition) in a line chart by server names
div.pre: eventtype=nmon:performance type=CPU_ALL frameID=$frameID$ hostname=$hostname$ | eval date_wday=lower(strftime('_time', "%A")) | eval local_time=strftime('_time', "%H%M") | search (date_wday!="sunday" date_wday!="saturday") AND (local_time>="0800" AND local_time<="1900") | timechart `nmon_span` avg(cpu_load_percent) AS cpu_load_percent by hostname

div.h2: Compare Average CPU usage of yesterday versus today in a line chart of a specific server with a static span of 5 minutes (time reference of yesterday)
div.pre: eventtype=nmon:performance type=CPU_ALL frameID=$frameID$ hostname=$hostname$ | timechart span=5m avg(cpu_load_percent) AS usage_yesterday | appendcols [ search eventtype=nmon:performance type=CPU_ALL frameID=$frameID$ hostname=$hostname$ earliest="@d" latest="+1d@d" | timechart span=5m avg(cpu_load_percent) AS usage_today | fields - _time ]

div.h2: Gauge chart of average CPU Usage in Percentage over last 24 hours
div.pre: eventtype=nmon:performance type=CPU_ALL frameID=$frameID$ hostname=$hostname$ | stats avg(cpu_load_percent) AS avg | eval avg=round(avg, 2)

div.h2: Column chart of TOP 10 average CPU Usage in Percentage over last 24 hours
div.pre: eventtype=nmon:performance type=CPU_ALL frameID=$frameID$ hostname=$hostname$ | stats avg(cpu_load_percent) AS cpu_load_percent by hostname | sort - cpu_load_percent | head 10 | eval xlabel="" | chart useother=f limit=0 values(cpu_load_percent) AS "Avg CPU %" by xlabel,hostname | rename xlabel AS "TOP 10 CPU % usage"

div.h2: Min / Average / Max CPU Usage in Percentage over last 24 hours ordered and sorted by frame ID, hostname
div.pre: eventtype=nmon:performance type=CPU_ALL frameID=$frameID$ hostname=$hostname$ | stats min(cpu_load_percent) AS "Min % CPU usage", avg(cpu_load_percent) AS "Avg % CPU usage", max(cpu_load_percent) AS "Max % CPU usage" by frameID,hostname | eval "Avg % CPU usage"=round('Avg % CPU usage', 2) | sort frameID,hostname

div.h2: Min / Average / Max and Average sparkline of CPU Usage in Percentage over last 24 hours ordered and sorted by frame ID, hostname
div.pre: eventtype=nmon:performance type=CPU_ALL frameID=$frameID$ hostname=$hostname$ | stats min(cpu_load_percent) AS "Min % CPU usage", avg(cpu_load_percent) AS "Avg % CPU usage", max(cpu_load_percent) AS "Max % CPU usage" by frameID,hostname | eval "Avg % CPU usage"=round('Avg % CPU usage', 2) | sort frameID,hostname

div.h2: Min / Average / Max of CPU Usage in Percentage over last 30 days for Business days only (monday to friday, 24hrs / 24hrs) ordered and sorted by frame ID, hostname
div.pre: eventtype=nmon:performance type=CPU_ALL frameID=$frameID$ hostname=$hostname$ | eval date_wday=lower(strftime('_time', "%A")) | search (date_wday!="sunday" date_wday!="saturday") | stats min(cpu_load_percent) AS "Min % CPU usage", avg(cpu_load_percent) AS "Avg % CPU usage", max(cpu_load_percent) AS "Max % CPU usage" by frameID,hostname | eval "Avg % CPU usage"=round('Avg % CPU usage', 2) | sort frameID,hostname

div.h2: Min / Average / Max of CPU Usage in Percentage over last 30 days for Working hours Business days only (monday to friday, 08h to 19h) ordered and sorted by frame ID, hostname
div.pre: eventtype=nmon:performance type=CPU_ALL frameID=$frameID$ hostname=$hostname$ | eval date_wday=lower(strftime('_time', "%A")) | eval local_time=strftime('_time', "%H%M") | search (date_wday!="sunday" date_wday!="saturday") AND (local_time>="0800" AND local_time<="1900") | stats min(cpu_load_percent) AS "Min % CPU usage", avg(cpu_load_percent) AS "Avg % CPU usage", max(cpu_load_percent) AS "Max % CPU usage" by frameID,hostname | eval "Avg % CPU usage"=round('Avg % CPU usage', 2) | sort frameID,hostname

div.h2: Min / Average / Max of CPU Usage in Percentage over last 30 days for non Working hours Business days only (monday to friday, 19h to 08h) ordered and sorted by frame ID, hostname
div.pre: eventtype=nmon:performance type=CPU_ALL frameID=$frameID$ hostname=$hostname$ | eval date_wday=lower(strftime('_time', "%A")) | eval local_time=strftime('_time', "%H%M") | search (local_time>="1900" AND local_time<="2359") OR (local_time>="0000" AND local_time<="0800") AND (date_wday!="sunday" date_wday!="saturday") | stats min(cpu_load_percent) AS "Min % CPU usage", avg(cpu_load_percent) AS "Avg % CPU usage", max(cpu_load_percent) AS "Max % CPU usage" by frameID,hostname | eval "Avg % CPU usage"=round('Avg % CPU usage', 2) | sort frameID,hostname

div.h2: Compare Average CPU Usage in Percentage of current month versus previous month ordered and sorted by hostname
div.pre: eventtype=nmon:performance hostname="*" type=CPU_ALL earliest="-1mon@mon" latest="@mon" | eval usage=cpu_load_percent | stats avg(usage) As usage_period1 by hostname | append [ search eventtype=nmon:performance hostname="*" type=CPU_ALL earliest="@mon" latest="now" | eval usage=cpu_load_percent | stats avg(usage) As usage_period2 by hostname ] | stats values(*) AS * by hostname | `eval_compare`

div.h2: Use transaction to find servers having an average CPU usage higher than 90% for a minimal contiguous period of 5 minutes
div.pre: eventtype=nmon:performance type=CPU_ALL frameID=$frameID$ hostname=$hostname$ | where cpu_load_percent>90 | transaction hostname cpu_load_percent maxpause=5m | where duration>300 | fields _time,frameID,hostname,duration,cpu_load_percent,Sys_PCT,User_PCT,Wait_PCT,Idle_PCT | stats values(*) AS * by _time,hostname | eval "duration (hh:mm:ss)"=tostring(duration,"duration") | rename duration AS "duration (seconds)" | fields _time,frameID,hostname,duration*,cpu_load_percent,Sys_PCT,User_PCT,Wait_PCT,Idle_PCT

div.h2: Use transaction to find servers having an average CPU usage higher than 90% for a minimal contiguous period of 5 minutes, restricted to Open hours and Business days (monday to friday, 08h to 19h)
div.pre: eventtype=nmon:performance type=CPU_ALL frameID=$frameID$ hostname=$hostname$ | eval date_wday=lower(strftime('_time', "%A")) | eval local_time=strftime('_time', "%H%M") | search (date_wday!="sunday" date_wday!="saturday") AND (local_time>="0800" AND local_time<="1900") | where cpu_load_percent>90 | transaction hostname cpu_load_percent maxpause=5m | where duration>300 | fields _time,frameID,hostname,duration,cpu_load_percent,Sys_PCT,User_PCT,Wait_PCT,Idle_PCT | stats values(*) AS * by _time,hostname | eval "duration (hh:mm:ss)"=tostring(duration,"duration") | rename duration AS "duration (seconds)" | fields _time,frameID,hostname,duration*,cpu_load_percent,Sys_PCT,User_PCT,Wait_PCT,Idle_PCT
